title: 103_hr43
content: The Act titled "Defense Nuclear Workers' Health Insurance Act of 1993" establishes a health insurance program for former Department of Energy employees exposed to ionizing radiation. The Secretary of Energy establishes a program to provide payment for health care expenses to former Department of Energy employees exposed to ionizing radiation at defense nuclear facilities. The program provides payment for health care expenses to former Department of Energy employees exposed to ionizing radiation at defense nuclear facilities. Eligibility criteria include employment in facilities with radioactive materials and not being entitled to Medicare benefits. Covered health care services include treatment for specific cancers like leukemia, multiple myeloma, and lymphoma. The program provides payment for health care expenses to former Department of Energy employees exposed to ionizing radiation at defense nuclear facilities. Eligibility criteria include specific cancers like leukemia, multiple myeloma, and lymphoma, as well as other diseases determined by the Secretary of Energy in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The program covers health care expenses for former Department of Energy employees exposed to ionizing radiation at defense nuclear facilities. Health services are defined as items and services covered by FEHBP plans or Medicare, including hospital services, physician services, prescription drugs, hospice care, and home health. The program covers health care expenses for former Department of Energy employees exposed to ionizing radiation at defense nuclear facilities. It includes outpatient prescription drugs, hospice care, home health services, skilled nursing facility services, and rehabilitation. The threshold dollar amount is $25,000 per individual during their lifetime. The Secretary of Energy may administer the program directly or through a memorandum of understanding with a federal department, agency, or health insurance carrier. The program must be established within 6 months of the Act's enactment and applies to expenses incurred for services provided after that date. Definitions include "FEHBP plan" as a health plan typical of those offered to Federal employees, "medicare program" as the program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act, and "Department of Energy defense nuclear facility" as a facility under the control of the Secretary of Energy operated for national security purposes. The term "Department of Energy defense nuclear facility" includes facilities conducting atomic energy defense activities, nuclear waste storage or disposal facilities under the Secretary of Energy's control, testing and assembly facilities operated for national security purposes, and nuclear weapons research facilities. The term "Department of Energy defense nuclear facility" includes facilities conducting atomic energy defense activities, nuclear waste storage or disposal facilities, testing and assembly facilities operated for national security purposes, and nuclear weapons research facilities under the control of the Secretary of Energy. This also encompasses facilities that are no longer operational, were previously under the Department of Defense, Atomic Energy Commission, or Energy Research and Development Administration's jurisdiction, and were operated for national security purposes.
